intro: Saurauia pringlei var. micrantha, commonly known as the micrantha saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. Native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders. The plant's botanical features reflect its adaptation to the harsh, mountainous climate of its native habitat.
